dmca.title: IFPI DMCA (Copyright) Complaint to Google
dmca.body:
RE:  

 http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/06/elton-john-julieta-venegas-cyndi-lauper.html

http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/05/ratatat-hold-steady-weezer-weather.html

http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/04/fall-out-boy-eurythmics-black-sabbath.html

 

 

Dear Sir/Madam

 

Second Notice of infringement of copyright in sound recordings by a Google AdSense subscriber

 

We refer to our email of 28th July 2008 below. 

 

Despite our earlier notification, the specified infringements of IFPI Represented Companies’ exclusive rights by a Google AdSense subscriber are continuing.  IFPI therefore repeats its request for your urgent assistance in relation to this activity.

 

Notice of infringement of copyright in sound recordings by a Google AdSense subscriber

 

As you are aware, IFPI, International Federation of the Phonographic Industry represents over 1,400 record producers in over 75 countries around the world. IFPI also has affiliated industry organisations in 49 countries worldwide. As part of this work, we monitor the Internet and take action regarding the use of music in a manner that infringes rights in sound recordings owned or controlled by our members and certain other record companies (the “IFPI Represented Companies”).

 

Please note that we have a signature on file with Google.

 

IFPI hereby notifies Google of the infringement of IFPI Represented Companies’ exclusive rights by a Google AdSense subscriber.

 

1.        We have established that, amongst others, the IFPI Representative Company-owned copyright sound recordings referred to below are being infringed by their unauthorised reproduction and/or making available via the following website:

 

http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com (the "Infringing Website")

 

The Infringing Website carries advertising supplied by Google.

 

2.        By way of example only, without authorisation the Infringing Website is making available sound files containing the following IFPI Represented Company-owned copyright sound recordings via the following locations on the Infringing Website:

 

Artist/ Album: Cyndi Lauper/ Collections

URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/06/elton-john-julieta-venegas-cyndi-lauper.html

 

Artist/ Album: Phil Collins/ The Platinum Collection

URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/06/elton-john-julieta-venegas-cyndi-lauper.html

 

Artist/ Album: Weather Report/ Heavy Weather

URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/05/ratatat-hold-steady-weezer-weather.html

 

Artist/ Album: Eurythmics/ Greatest Hits

URL: http://thankyoumusic.blogspot.com/2008/04/fall-out-boy-eurythmics-black-sabbath.html

 

 

3.        We can be contacted in relation to this notice via the following contact details:

 

E-mail:  [redacted]@ifpi.org

IFPI
 [redacted]
London W1J 0DD

United Kingdom

Tel: +44 [redacted]
Fax: +44 [redacted]

 

4.        We have a good faith belief that use of the copyright materials as described above is not authorised by the copyright owner, its agent or the law.

 

5.        We assert that the information in this notice is accurate, based on the data available to us.  We submit under penalty of perjury that IFPI is authorised to act on behalf of the owner of the exclusive rights that are allegedly infringed.

 

We hereby request your immediate assistance in relation to this activity on a Google AdSense supported website.  Specifically, we request that Google immediately withdraws the provision of the Google AdSense services to the Infringing Website by terminating the relevant subscriber and informs the site operator of the illegality of his or her conduct.

 

By submitting a notice in this form (as required by Google) regarding the AdSense services provided by Google and the infringement of copyright described above, IFPI neither admits nor accepts that Google is a 'service provider' for the purposes of the DMCA nor that it is necessary to serve or that Google is entitled to be served a notice in compliance with the DMCA.  IFPI itself and on behalf of the IFPI Represented Companies hereby expressly reserves all rights in this regard.

 

In addition, this notice does not constitute a waiver of any right to recover damages incurred by virtue of any unauthorised activities described in this notice, and such rights as well as claims for other relief are hereby expressly reserved. 

 

Thank you for your co-operation.

 

Yours faithfully

 

 [redacted]

Vice-President, Internet Anti-Piracy

Tel: [redacted] 

Fax:  [redacted]

E-mail: [redacted]@ifpi.org

Website: www.ifpi.org
